answers.answer: I'm a little confused. Are you saying your baby measures 33 wks?
you said in another post you have gestational diabetes.  I know that can cause babies to be larger.

I have diabetes. And both of my boys measured a few weeks bigger when it came to the end of my PG. When I was 39 wks they were measuring 43 wks. SO it is normal for having GD. But be cautious and REALLY try to control your blood sugar. Cause if the baby shows too big, you will most likely have to have a C section and they may have to take it early.Good luck.~Candi
yes, measured at 33 weeks instead 30 weeks.

My son always measured right on to maybe a week ahead at the end.  I was not diabetic and he was still over 10 lbs., just tucked way back in there.  I would just watch your diet, somne babies can get really big, can't imagine what would've happened to mine if I had been diabetic too.  Your Dr. will monitor them though and you may end up with a C-section if your little one is too big, but really, it would be better for you.  Good luck with your little one!  At least you know you have a big healthy baby!

question: Is it normal to have a larger three week baby at 30 weeks?
title: larger three week baby at 30 weeks
